messageBody:
Well, I found sourceforge's CVS and finally got ahold of the
textui.TestRunner.java code. Looking at it, it seems there's no way
for the static method run to return a status code or throw an
exception. It would seem I was using the wrong method.

It does look like if I call that static main method that it will
return a System.exit(1) when it reaches the end of the method, which
is what I want for ant's purposes. I can't understand how the author
the ant & junit article on junit.org got his to work though. Earlier
version perhaps with a different functionality? Oh well.

Can anyone see any possible problems with using main like a normal
static method? This is the source code:

public static void main(String args[]) {
TestRunner aTestRunner= new TestRunner();
try {
TestResult r= aTestRunner.start(args);
if (!r.wasSuccessful())
System.exit(-1);
System.exit(0);
} catch(Exception e) {
System.err.println(e.getMessage());
System.exit(-2);
}
}



I'm also still going to look Andrew Fuqua'a solution.

Perry Tew
